trial_identification.studytitle: Long-term weight and glycaemic outcomes of gastric band surgery in diabetes
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Long-term weight and glycaemic outcomes of gastric band surgery in diabetes

interventions.interventions: 10-year follow-up following gastric band surgery to effect weight loss in obese people.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Body weight by calibrated digital scales

secondaryOutcome.outcome: HbA1c, measured by routine biochemical assay
Quality of life, assessed using SF-36 questionnairre
Medication use, assessed by patient interview
lipid profile measured by routine biochemical assay

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Had type 2 diabetes when undergoing gastric band surgery between 2003 and 2005 at the Centre for Bariatric Surgery, Melbourne

trial_design.statisticalmethods: We will use Prism v6 and R software to analyse data. Categorical and continuous data will be compared by Fishers exact and t-test where appropriate. For regression analyses, the significance of each variable will be established via analysis of deviance with a t-test. Based on our previous experience, a sample size of at least 50 will be sufficient to produce robust data.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Monash CORE Level 6 Alfred Centre 99 Commercial Rd Melbourne Vic 3004

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Level 6 Alfred Centre 99 Commercial Rd Melbourne Vic 3004

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is an analysis of weight and diabetes outcomes ten years after gastric band surgery to treat obesity. Participants will be identified from a clinical database, which will provide baseline data. Ten-year data will be collected prospectively during routine clinic attendance.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Monash Research Office Building 3d Monash University Victoria 3800 Australia
